reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Reduce the impact of the negative effect for the winter season for the IDP's living into informal settlements in Aleppo and Idleb governorate

description.narrative:
The proposed project is designed to respond to the needs related to winterization intervention for the IDPs (3100 HH, 20,220 beneficiaries) who are settled in informal settlements in Aleppo governorate (Atareb Sub District) and Idleb Governerate (Dana Sub District) which is classified as high need sub district in the allocation paper for both allocation strategic objectives, by providing the most urgent life-saving winterization intervention which is in line with ASO2 under SA2. The assistance will take the people centered approach taking into consideration equity in access, quality, responsiveness and participation, efficacy and resilience the intervention can be summarized as the following: - Under FSL Cluster: the project will cover the distribution of Food Rations (1500 FR) fpr 1500 HH settled in 14 camp as per cluster guideline for 6 months. This activity will target all beneficiaries in the targeted informal settlements. These food rations will be distributed once a month and for 6 months by informing the targeted HHs about the timing and the location as well, taking into consideration the COVID-19 preventive measures in addition to deliver the FRs to the HHs that are headed by females, contain PwD or children in order to ensure their safety and dignity as well. This intervention is classified under ASO2 Cluster Specific Objective.
- Under SNFI Cluster: Project will cover the distribution of stoves, heating fuel ( for 3 months), thermal blankets and plastic sheets according to the SNFI guideline for 3100 HH settled in 23 camps. The stoves will be delivered on HH level and ATAA will ensure that the stoves are installed in a proper way and put in a safe location in each tent to ensure better effectiveness. The heating fuel which is Olive bit/Pomace will be distributed for 3 months (three rounds) to cover the winter season and each HH will receive 250 kg/month. Each HH will also receive 5 single thermal blankets along with 2 plastic sheets as one-off distribution in the project period to increase the efficiency of the heating that is being secured by the distributed stoves and fuel. These items will be distributed by informing the targeted HHs about the timing and the location as well, taking into consideration the COVID-19 mitigating and preventive measures and also deliver the materials to the HHs which are headed by females, PwD and children (door-to-door distribution) in order to ensure their safety and dignity as well. This intervention is classified under ASO2 Cluster Specific Objective. - Under CCCM Cluster: The project will cover the enhancement of the capacity of the camps' representatives in the targeted informal settlements to prevent, mitigate and respond to the fire incidents by conducting FGDs and awareness-raising sessions with the camp management and beneficiaries taking into practice and account the COVID-19 preventive measures during the awareness-raising sessions and FGD's along with developing fire warden systems in the targeted camps. Additionally, the project will ensure the provision of fire extinguishers and fire blankets to enhance the capacity of the people on firefighting by providing them with the needed materials in the targeted informal settlements in case of any fire incident occurring. This intervention is classified under ASO2 Cluster Specific Objective this intervention will target 3100 HH settled in 23 camps
ATAA took into consideration during project design phase, that the project and proposed activities are cost efficient to ensure the impact of the intervention. Additionally, the implementation of the project will be started immediately while ATAA have launched the procurement process following the approved procurement policy by OCHA especially for the seasonal assistant.
